t: How to Find Products Sold and Shipped by Amazon: SBA Explained
s: February 28, 2025 - Sold by Amazon (SBA) is a program that allows brand owners to have their products sold and shipped by Amazon. Upon enrollment in the SBA program, the ownership of products is transferred to Amazon, meaning they remain Amazon's property until purchased by a customer.

Certified Refurbished Amazon Devices work and look like new and are backed with the same limited warranty as a new device. Used Amazon Devices are fully functional pre-owned units that have been tested and verified by Amazon to meet the specified product condition.

t: Amazon keeps track of every purchase you've ever made — here's how to see the list
s: April 26, 2019 - Go to Amazon.com and log in to your account. Tap "Account & Lists" on the top right. Choose "Download order reports" under the "Ordering and shopping preferences" section. Select a report type: "Items" is default and shows all shipments, but use the drop-down to switch to "refunds" or "returns."

t: What Is the Used Like New Condition for Amazon Products?
s: The e-commerce giant has several conditions, ranging from brand new to heavily used. Amazon's dedication to providing detailed product conditions stems from its commitment to customer satisfaction and trust.
